thread.title: Texans Have Met With ZERO Potential FA Signees & Have Signed ZERO New Players
thread.title_full: Texans Have Met With ZERO Potential FA Signees & Have Signed ZERO New Players

title: Texans Have Met With ZERO Potential FA Signees & Have Signed ZERO New Players

organizations.name: fa signees & have signed zero new players houston

text:
Houston Texans Haven’t Visited With Any Free Agents March 21, 2017 9:15 AM By Garret Heinrich Filed Under: free agent , Houston Texans (Photo by Ronald Martinez/Getty Images) 
Houston (CBS HOUSTON) – The Houston Texans have been extremely quiet during NFL Free Agency. So quiet in fact, they actually have not even had any potential free agents visit with the team SportsRadio 610 has learned. 
The Texans remain the only team in the NFL that has yet to sign any free agent that was not on their roster in 2016. The only resigned players the Texans retained were punter Shane Lechler, kicker Nick Novak and tight end Ryan Griffin . They have seen LB John Simon , CB A.J. Bouye & offensive lineman Oday Abushi all sign elsewhere. They also traded away quarterback Brock Osweiler . 
The Texans are supposed to be in the running for Dallas Cowboys quarterback Tony Romo, but despite thoughts that he would be released and a free agent already, Romo is still on the Cowboys roster. Now 12 days into the free agency period the Texans have not even visited with any players to potentially sign for the 2017 season.
